summary: Could you reccomend any 'different dimensions/travel' fics?, i just love this concept so much
question: Could you reccomend any 'different dimensions/travel' fics?, i just love this concept so much
answer:
Parallel World Travel List

The world without me/Erased by SchoolgirlQ

Pro hero “Deku”, after an unsuccessful attempt at capturing S class villain “Space Creature”, was thrown into a space tunnel connected to a parallel world without him.
In that parallel world, Midoriya Izuku’s bright young life ended at age 15.

Cause of death: “falling from heights”.

[6/30 Chapters - Teen and Up Audiences]

Make Every Moment Last by osakakitty

There are days where Izuku Midoriya wakes in a different world. It is usually a world very similar to his own, but with noticeable changes. The thing that changes the most is Katsuki Bakugo. Sometimes he’s a friend, sometimes he’s not, and sometimes he’s something else entirely.

Canon-Divergent story where Midoriya has the uncontrollable ability to travel to parallel universes. He sleeps in one, and may wake up in another. By seeing through the eyes of many different ‘Izuku Midoriya,’ he learns things about himself and Bakugo.

[Explicit - One-shot]

Izuku and the Warp Gate by GreyLiliy

A homemade rip between the universes trades one Izuku for another, leaving both of them in unfamiliar territory. The Hero must find a way back to where he belongs before the Villain makes himself too much at home. Along the way, Izuku finds himself dealing with warped versions of the people that he loves—Including Kacchan.

[Teen and Up Audiences - 10/? Chapters - Villain]

Dividing Line by astraliix

If you can get any wish granted, surely go for it, no?
Hearing a rumor in U.A, Izuku goes to the lake alone in hopes to have his wish granted. Rather than having his wish come true, he dragged into a mysterious universe, where he meets what’s apperantly their alter ego. As if that wasn’t already bad enough, his heart is taken and without it, he will die, nor will he be able to return back to his world. To get it back his only choice is to fulfill Aizawa’s absurd propusal. It’s all or nothing.

[Teen and Up Audiences - 4/? Chapters]

Running Parallel by Arysa

There are as many universes as there are choices to be made. Just as the beat of a butterfly’s wings creates a merciless hurricane, one decision can split a universe in two. Left or right, good or evil, wrong or right, villain or hero… an infinite number of possibilities. And when Midoriya Izuku is suddenly thrown into a parallel universe by a frightened civilian’s quirk, he learns exactly how a simple, seemingly insignificant, choice can alter a world drastically.

[Mature - 6/? Chapters - Pro Heroes Deku & Ground Zero]

harmonize by wbtrashking (fan_nerd)

When Bakugou disappears mid-battle, Midoriya is panicked, to say the least. His worries are not assuaged by the appearance of what seems to be a younger version of Katsuki, asking a hundred and one questions.

Unfortunately, there are just some things that Midoriya can’t answer. Or rather, he doesn’t want to. He can’t risk ruining the life they’ve built together. Not now. Not after everything they’ve been through.

Still, Katsuki’s arrival in the future is the least of his problems. Midoriya has to find some way to help his Bakugou make it home, ideally before he strangles his bullheaded, teenage doppelgänger.

[Mature - One-shot - Time Travel]

Be Rough with Love by isildursheir

“You think you are a hero? You think you are wondrous and sublime? I will show you the truth of who you are, Midoriya Izuku. I will show you the place where you are abominable and terrible.”

Izuku hadn’t understood what the words meant, then. But he thought that maybe he was starting to get it, now.

(Or: A villain’s Quirk sends Izuku to an alternate universe in which the villains triumph, the heroes have lost hope, the world is ending, and nobody trusts him because in this world, he is the worst villain of them all.)

[Mature - 1/15 Chapters - Villain]

I hope you all enjoy it!!

title: Zero to Hero
description:
by ryrybread

Midoriya Izuku has had a hard time getting through life as long as he could remember. Not only was he quirkless, but he was born in the wrong body, gender-wise.
If it wasn’t for his childhood friend standing up for him, he wouldn’t even been here, let alone being face to face with his ultimate role model, All Might.
Follow Izuku through his high school experience, dealing with feelings, villains, and transitioning to become the boy he always was meant to me.

Words: 962, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M, Multi
  • Characters: Midoriya Izuku, Todoroki Shouto, Bakugou Katsuki, Midoriya Inko, Kirishima Eijirou, Kayama Nemuri | Midnight, Yagi Toshinori | All Might, Midoriya Hisashi, Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead, Mineta Minoru, Ashido Mina, Kaminari Denki, Iida Tenya, Uraraka Ochako, Asui Tsuyu, Todoroki Rei
  • Relationships: Bakugou Katsuki/Midoriya Izuku, Bakugou Katsuki/Kirishima Eijirou, Kirishima Eijirou/Midoriya Izuku, Midoriya Izuku/Todoroki Shouto, Bakugou Katsuki/Kirishima Eijirou/Midoriya Izuku, Bakugou Katsuki/Midoriya Izuku/Todoroki Shouto
  • Additional Tags: trans!izuku, Mineta is a transphobic lil shit, Polyamory, childhood crush, Izuku meets Rei, Trans Kirishima Eijirou, They are all neurotypical

summary: I would like a scenario where the boys of class 1-A get in a spicy eating contest and are surprised to find that Tokoyami can't...
question: I would like a scenario where the boys of class 1-A get in a spicy eating contest and are surprised to find that Tokoyami can't feel spiciness (Because he's a bird)
answer:
━━━━━━━☆☆━━━━━━━

It was a Friday night before a week-long school break, and class 1-A decided to throw a party in the common room. The rule was that everyone had to bring some kind of food or game.

Mina decided to be extra and bring something that was both a food AND a game.

She and some of the girls had disappeared into the kitchen at the start of the party, busy preparing for the biggest spectacle of the entire night. They were making an entire bulk pack of extremely spicy ramen, with the addition of some of Mina’s “additives” to make it as unbearable as possible (Jalapeños, black pepper, etc.)

When it was all ready, she gathered everyone around the community table.

“THIS is going to officially decide which of you boys is the strongest!”

The boys were looking around at each other anxiously. If it was something Mina had planned, it could quite possibly kill somebody. Or all of them.

She unveiled the boiling pot of despair. The smell was enough to make even the toughest of men’s eyes water. About half of the competitors backed out immediately.

“Whoever wins gets this homework pass I stole from Aizawa’s desk!”

Okay, they’re in.

Each of the boys were served up a bowl and at Mina’s signal, began their race to finish. Aoyama took a bite and tried to hide the pain on his face, but his wavering smile wasn’t fooling anybody. He clutched his stomach and ran out.

Iida, after declaring his vexation for the stupidity of the contest, reluctantly took in a forkful. He sat back in his chair with his arms crossed. However, the food sat in his mouth, remaining uneaten as his face reddended.

Ojiro took one look at the bowl and became worried for his health, so he pushed it away from him before the fumes killed every cell in his body. Disqualified.

Kaminari eagerly slurped up the entire bowl, prepared to be crowned as the stronget in the class. He only got about half of it down before and slamming his fist on the table in resignation.

Kirishima had the same method as Kaminari, though was able to eat about three quarters of his bowl before giving up as well. Nobody had ever seen the red haired boy look so ill. They almost thought about calling recovery girl in to make sure he didn’t die.

Koda ate one noodle and then spit it out in a napkin. Afterwards he just quietly slinked up to his room to avoid the embarrassment.

Sato slyly poured a packed of sugar from his pocket into his bowl, hoping to ease the spice a bit with it. Unfortunately, however, it did absolutely nothing and soon enough he was raiding the refrigerator for a gallon of milk to chug.

Shoji didn’t really have an…available mouth…to eat with. He wouldn’t have eaten it anyway.

Sero’s face turned so unnaturally red that Mina came over to pat his back. At least he tried.

Todoroki seemed unfazed but couldn’t finish more than a few bites.

Bakugo eats most of it but has to clench his fist to avoid yelling out.

Midoriya sipped a bit of the broth but was immediately chugging down his glass of water.

Everyone was so preoccupied with the disaster before them that nobody noticed Tokoyami’s empty bowl.

“Aaand the winner is…TOKOYAMI!”

“What the hell!?”

Bakugo was amazed–and jealous–that ANYBODY could eat that.

“Birds have less tastebuds and are less sensitive to capsaicin.”

“Um…excuse me?

Kaminari, alone with the rest of class 1-a, were oblivious as to what Tokoyami was talking about.

"It’s the chemical that makes peppers spicy. And since my head it a bird, I have the same capacity for spicy food.”

“That’s…actually pretty awesome.”

Most of the class was impressed, but his explanation didn’t make Bakugo any less angry.

“I swear I’m going to kill you.”

question: Bakugo + 72?
answer:
Bakugou Katsuki 

Bakugou’s sweetness was something you never seemed to get used to even after dating for approximately three months. Even though his affections are still rough around the edges, his intentions were always pure when it came to you. He was always looking out for you even in the shadows and knows you well enough to notice when you’re hiding something from him. This was evident when you had exams coming up and couldn’t keep up with your studies which led you to cram all of the materials in a short amount of time. 

Bakugou had a suspicious inkling that you’ve been spending many late nights studying in your dorm room, even though you managed to fool most of your classmates with your beaming enthusiasm despite being heavily sleep deprived and constantly dozing off in the middle of lectures. When school came to an end, Bakugou took a hold of your hand and dragged you out of the premise and to his dorm room without so much of a warning. You made many attempts trying to gain an understanding of his goal but was left clueless until he placed you on his bed. 

“You need sleep,” Bakugou finally announces as he crosses his muscular arms over his chest and peers down at you with crimson hues. His words didn’t seem to register in your mind until a moment later and you insisted that you were completely fine but Bakugou immediately countered your response. 

“Don’t lie to me, you’re not fine. I know you’ve been staying up late at night for the past few days. Now do us both a favor and get some sleep so I can stop worrying about you.”

You felt a small tug at your heartstrings after learning he was worried about you because if you had known Bakugou, he doesn’t casually throw that word around let alone feel such an emotion about anyone. Your mouth curves into a smile and you took the opportunity to tease him for troubling himself over something so insignificant but it was really nice to know that he kept you in his thoughts. 

“I’ll sleep better with you next to me.”

summary: I love Shinsou/Kouda!!! What about Tokoyami/Kouda?
question: I love Shinsou/Kouda!!! What about Tokoyami/Kouda?
answer:
I love Tokoyami x Kouda too! This is really cute, most Kouda ships are tbh. I could see Tokoyami acting all edgy and stuff while Kouda finds it cute.

 I have been planning to write a fic of them actually. One that takes place in an alternativ magic-1800ish universe. Kouda is stuck in a cave since he is cursed. One day a hurt crow flies in there and land beside Kouda. The crow turned out to be a shapeshifter who goes by the name of Tokoyami. Kouda take cares of him until he is healed and they both fall in love. Tokoyami tries to find a way to break the curse but it ends up with him finding out that Kouda isn’t stuck in the cave because he is cursed, it is because Kouda is already dead and the cave is keeping him alive for some reasons. Shit happens and I guess Kouda moves on while Tokoyami becomes depressed af. Idk, didn’t plan so much and I got really lazy. 

What is your thought on this ship?

title: Zero to Hero
description:
by ryrybread

Midoriya Izuku has had a hard time getting through life as long as he could remember. Not only was he quirkless, but he was born in the wrong body, gender-wise.

summary: Okay I'm 30 minutes into Good Omens. Does no one else see the parallels between Bakugou and Kirishima, and Crowley and...
body:
Okay I’m 30 minutes into Good Omens. Does no one else see the parallels between Bakugou and Kirishima, and Crowley and Aziraphale?

Kirishima the sunshine god child meant to stop the evil. And Bakugou, the less than reputable evil that flirts with the sunshine god child but also doesn’t want the world to end.
